maml:description.maml:para: Exports firewall rules to a CSV or JSON file

Export-FirewallRule exports firewall rules to a CSV or JSON file. Only local GPO rules are exported by default. CSV files are semicolon separated (Beware! Excel is not friendly to CSV files). All rules are exported by default, you can filter with parameter -Name, -Inbound, -Outbound, -Enabled, -Disabled, -Allow and -Block. If the export file already exists it's content will be replaced by default.
Computer name from which to export rules, default is local GPO.
Path into which to save file. Wildcard characters are supported.
Output file, default is CSV format
Display name of the rules to be processed. Wildcard character * is allowed.
Display group of the rules to be processed. Wildcard character * is allowed.
Output in JSON instead of CSV format
Export inbound rules
Export outbound rules
Export enabled rules
Export disabled rules
Export allowing rules
Export blocking rules
Append exported rules to existing file. By default file of same name is replaced with new content
Computer name from which to export rules, default is local GPO.
Path into which to save file. Wildcard characters are supported.
Output file, default is CSV format
Display name of the rules to be processed. Wildcard character * is allowed.
Display group of the rules to be processed. Wildcard character * is allowed.
Output in JSON instead of CSV format
Export inbound rules
Export outbound rules
Export enabled rules
Export disabled rules
Export allowing rules
Export blocking rules
Append exported rules to existing file. By default file of same name is replaced with new content

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to Export-FirewallRule
None. Export-FirewallRule does not generate any output

maml:alert.maml:para: Author: Markus Scholtes Version: 1.02 Build date: 2020/02/15

Following modifications by metablaster August 2020: 1. Applied formatting and code style according to project rules 2. Added switch to optionally append instead of replacing output file 3. Separated functions into their own scope 4. Added function to decode string into multi line 5. Added parameter to target specific policy store 6. Added parameter to specify directory, and crate it if it doesn't exist 7. Added more output streams for debug, verbose and info 8. Added parameter to export according to rule group 9. Changed minor flow and logic of execution 10. Make output formatted and colored 11. Added progress bar December 2020: 1. Rename parameters according to standard name convention 2. Support resolving path wildcard pattern January 2022: 1. Implemented appending to json

dev:remarks.maml:para: Exports all firewall rules to the CSV file FirewallRules.csv in the current directory.
Exports all inbound and allowing firewall rules to the CSV file FirewallRules.csv in the current directory.
Exports all ICMP firewall rules to the JSON file ICMPRules.json.

maml:description.maml:para: Export firewall settings and profile setup to file
Export-FirewallSetting exports all firewall settings to file excluding firewall rules
Computer name from which to export settings, default is local GPO.
Path into which to save file. Wildcard characters are supported.
Output file name, json format
Computer name from which to export settings, default is local GPO.
Path into which to save file. Wildcard characters are supported.
Output file name, json format

maml:description.maml:para: Exports firewall rules to a CSV or JSON file from registry

Export-RegistryRule exports firewall rules to a CSV or JSON file directly from registry. Only local GPO rules are exported by default. CSV files are semicolon separated. All rules are exported by default, you can filter with parameter -Name, -Inbound, -Outbound, -Enabled, -Disabled, -Allow and -Block. If the export file already exists it's content will be replaced by default.
Computer name from which to export rules, default is local GPO.
Path into which to save file. Wildcard characters are supported.
Output file, default is CSV format
Display name of the rules to be processed. Wildcard character * is allowed.
Display group of the rules to be processed. Wildcard character * is allowed.
Output in JSON instead of CSV format
Export inbound rules
Export outbound rules
Export enabled rules
Export disabled rules
Export allowing rules
Export blocking rules
Append exported rules to existing file. By default file of same name is replaced with new content
Computer name from which to export rules, default is local GPO.
Path into which to save file. Wildcard characters are supported.
Output file, default is CSV format
Display name of the rules to be processed. Wildcard character * is allowed.
Display group of the rules to be processed. Wildcard character * is allowed.
Output in JSON instead of CSV format

maml:description.maml:para: Get all firewall rules without or with specified LocalUser value

Get all rules which are either missing missing LocalUser value or rules which match specified LocalUser value, and save the result into a JSON file. Intended purpose of this function is to find rules without LocalUser value set to be able to quickly sport incomplete rules and assign LocalUser value for security reasons.
Path into which to save file. Wildcard characters are supported.
Output file name, which is json file into which result is saved
User for which to obtain rules
Group for which to obtain rules
Firewall rule direction, default is '*' both directions
Path into which to save file. Wildcard characters are supported.
Output file name, which is json file into which result is saved
User for which to obtain rules
Firewall rule direction, default is '*' both directions

maml:description.maml:para: Get potentially weak firewall rules

Find-WeakRule gets all rules which are not restrictive enough, and saves the result into a JSON file. Intended purpose of this function is to find potentially weak rules to be able to quickly sport incomplete rules to update them as needed for security reasons.
Path into which to save file. Wildcard characters are supported.
Output file name, which is json file into which result is saved
Firewall rule direction, default is '*' both directions
Path into which to save file. Wildcard characters are supported.
Output file name, which is json file into which result is saved
Firewall rule direction, default is '*' both directions

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to Find-WeakRule

maml:description.maml:para: Format output of the Net-NewFirewallRule commandlet
Output of Net-NewFirewallRule is large, loading a lot of rules would spam the console very fast, this function helps to output only relevant, formatted and colored output
Firewall rule to format, by default output status represents loading rule
If specified, output status represents rule modification
Firewall rule to format, by default output status represents loading rule
If specified, output status represents importing rule
Firewall rule to format, by default output status represents loading rule
If specified, output status represents rule modification
If specified, output status represents importing rule

dev:type.maml:name: None. Format-RuleOutput does not generate any output

maml:alert.maml:para: TODO: For force loaded rules it should say: "Force Load Rule:"

maml:description.maml:para: Gets firewall rules directly from registry
Get-RegistryRule gets firewall rules by drilling registry and parsing registry values. This method to retrieve rules results is very fast export compared to conventional way.
Computer name from which rules are to be retrieved
Retrive rules from persistent store (control panel firewall)
Retrive rules from local group policy store (GPO firewall)
Specifies that only matching firewall rules of the indicated display name are retrieved Wildcard characters are accepted.
Specifies that only matching firewall rules of the indicated group association are retrieved Wildcard characters are accepted.
Specifies that matching firewall rules of the indicated direction are retrieved
Specifies that matching firewall rules of the indicated action are retrieved
Specifies that matching firewall rules of the indicated state are retrieved
Computer name from which rules are to be retrieved
Retrive rules from persistent store (control panel firewall)
Retrive rules from local group policy store (GPO firewall)
Specifies that only matching firewall rules of the indicated display name are retrieved Wildcard characters are accepted.
Specifies that only matching firewall rules of the indicated group association are retrieved Wildcard characters are accepted.
Specifies that matching firewall rules of the indicated direction are retrieved
Specifies that matching firewall rules of the indicated action are retrieved
Specifies that matching firewall rules of the indicated state are retrieved

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to Get-RegistryRule

maml:alert.maml:para: TODO: Getting rules from persistent store (-Local switch) needs testing. TODO: Design, Parameters -Local and -GroupPolicy must be converted to -PolicyStore? what about -Domain then? Not implementing more parameters because only those here are always present in registry in all rules. ParameterSetName = "NotAllowingEmptyString" is there because $DisplayName if not specified casts to empty string due to [string] declaration, which is the same thing as specifying -DisplayName "", we deny both with dummy parameter set name and setting default parameter set name to something else.

maml:description.maml:para: Imports firewall rules from a CSV or JSON file
Imports firewall rules exported with Export-FirewallRule, CSV or JSON file. CSV files have to be separated with semicolons. Existing rules with same name will not be overwritten by default.
Computer name onto which to import rules, default is local GPO.
Path to directory where the exported rules file is located. Wildcard characters are supported.
Export file file containing firewall rules
Input from JSON instead of CSV format
Overwrite existing rules with same name as rules being imported
Computer name onto which to import rules, default is local GPO.
Path to directory where the exported rules file is located. Wildcard characters are supported.
Export file file containing firewall rules
Input from JSON instead of CSV format
Overwrite existing rules with same name as rules being imported

dev:remarks.maml:para: Imports all firewall rules in the CSV file FirewallRules.csv If no file is specified, FirewallRules .csv or .json in the current directory is searched.
Imports all firewall rules from the JSON file WmiRules

maml:description.maml:para: Import firewall settings and profile setup to file
Import-FirewallSetting imports all firewall settings from file previously exported by Export-FirewallSetting
Computer name onto which to import settings, default is local GPO.
Path to directory where the exported settings file is located. Wildcard characters are supported.
Input file
Computer name onto which to import settings, default is local GPO.
Path to directory where the exported settings file is located. Wildcard characters are supported.
Input file

maml:description.maml:para: Removes firewall rules according to a list in a CSV or JSON file

Removes firewall rules according to Export-FirewallRule or Export-RegistryRule generated list in a CSV or JSON file. CSV files have to be separated with semicolons. Only the field Name is used (or if Name is missing, DisplayName is used), all other fields can be omitted.
Computer name from which remove rules, default is local GPO.
Folder in which file is located. Wildcard characters are supported.
File name according to which to delete rules
Input file in JSON instead of CSV format
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Computer name from which remove rules, default is local GPO.
Folder in which file is located. Wildcard characters are supported.
File name according to which to delete rules
Input file in JSON instead of CSV format
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
